title: Feature request: export Metrics for Prometheus

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

body:
<!--

Welcome :-)

So you've got an idea to improve rclone? We love that! You'll be glad to hear we've incorporated hundreds of ideas from contributors already.

Here is a checklist of things to do:

  1. Please search the old issues first for your idea and +1 or comment on an existing issue if possible.
  2. Discuss on the forum first: https://forum.rclone.org/
  3. Make a feature request issue (this is the right place!).
  4. Be prepared to get involved making the feature :-)

Looking forward to your great idea!

The Rclone Developers

-->


#### What is your current rclone version (output from `rclone version`)?

Docker image tag 1.50

#### What problem are you are trying to solve?

Getting metrics of jobs into a Prometheus scrapable format or pushing into Pushgateway. In a Kubernetes world, where rclone runs as a (Cron)job for backing up application data (e.g. S3 mirroring), the monitoring of jobs and failures is cumbersome. Usually it's done with Prometheus as it's the default monitoring solution.

#### How do you think rclone should be changed to solve that?

The current method of providing CLI flag `--rc --rc-addr "0.0.0.0:5572"` will enable a webserver that responds with a JSON when accessing `/core/stats`. It would be nice if we can alter the query (e.g. ?format=prometheus) so that it would provide the metrics in OpenMetrics/Prometheus format. That probably should also become a GET request instead of POST. Or another solution altogether.

We maintain currently a dedicated project https://github.com/vshn/rclone-exporter that does the JSON-to-prometheus translation, but we figure it's best if it's directly integrated into rclone. For testing purposes one could use this side-project in the meantime.
